newsitem.title: PERU: Peru to suspend anchovy fishing due to El Nino.
newsitem.headline: Peru to suspend anchovy fishing due to El Nino.

text.p: The Peruvian government announced Wednesday an anchovy fishing ban starting July 18 to protect the species from the damaging effects of the growing weather phenomenon El Nino.
The ban was decreed in the official daily El Peruano and signed by temporary Fisheries Minister Gustavo Caillaux Zazzali.

El Nino has raised the Pacific water temperatures and disrupted the distribution of fishing stocks, especially anchovies, affecting reproduction cycles and pushing them further south in search of cooler waters.
El Peruano said El Nino could be particularly damaging this year because it will occur during the anchovy reproductive season.
Fishing industry leaders have objected to the ban, saying it gives an unfair advantage to competitors in Chile.

The El Peruano decree did not say how long the ban would last. It reversed the government's decision earlier this year to allow a total of 4,300,000 tones of anchovies to be fished in Peruvian waters between April and September.
